column1: Queen Creek is a town in Maricopa and Pinal counties in the state of Arizona. The population was 26
column2: 361 at the 2010 census.  As of July 2019
column3: Queen Creek's population is estimated to be 50

column1: == History ==
From the post office form on file at the National Archives
column2: Queen Creek was originally known as Rittenhouse
column3: the community growing up out of a railroad stop. In 1919 the Queen Creek Farms Company was formed by C. H. Rittenhouse
column4: constructing that railroad stop to ship the goods from the farm. As for the creek it takes its name from
column6: flowed through Queen Canyon and was named for the Silver Queen Mine
column7: but it was originally called Picket Post Creek.

column1: == Geography ==
The Town of Queen Creek is primarily within Maricopa County
column2: but the Town Limits also extend into Pinal County on the eastern and southern borders. Even further to the east and south of QC Town Limits in Pinal County is the large (est. 87
column3: 000 population in 2015) unincorporated community of San Tan Valley.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the town has a total area of 25.8 square miles (66.8 km2)

column1: == Education ==
The Town of Queen Creek is served by six public school districts as well as public charter schools and a private school.
Queen Creek Unified School District serves the greatest number of Queen Creek students.
Queen Creek High School
Newell Barney Junior HighThe other public district schools serving QC students are Higley Unified School District
column4: and the Coolidge Unified School District

column1: Public charter schools serving QC students include...
American Leadership Academy is a local public charter district with a K-6 school and 7–12 high school located on the same campus at the southwest corner of Hawes Road and Chandler Heights Blvd.
American Leadership Academy High SchoolBenjamin Franklin Charter School
column3: Heritage Academy are additional public charter schools educating students who live in Town of Queen Creek.

column1: Higher Education offerings include Communiversity at Queen Creek (Rio Salado College).
== Cultural attractions ==
The American Heritage Festival – Since 2003 the largest annual educational living history event in Arizona and the Southwestern US.
Schnepf Farms – a family operated farm that holds frequent festivals
The Queen Creek Performing Arts Center
Horseshoe Park & Equestrian Centre – a large
column2: publicly owned and operated equestrian facility that hosts regional events.

column1: Queen Creek Library – the newest branch of the Maricopa County Library District that opened November 8
Barney Family Sports Complex – a privately owned and operated indoor sports facility.
Queen Creek Olive Mill – a family owned company that grows and presses olives for the production of high quality extra virgin. It was featured on the Food Network show The Best Thing I Ever Ate.
Rittenhouse Elementary School/San Tan Historical Society Museum
== Historic properties ==

There are various properties in the town of Queen Creek which are considered historical and have been included either in the National Register of Historic Places or listed as such by the San Tan Historical Society.
